chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
n: nat

Goal:
n <> 0 -> {l : list nat | n = lprod l /\ Forall prime l}

Premises:
Inductive list (A : Type) : Type := nil : list A | cons : A -> list A -> list A Arguments list _%type_scope Arguments nil {A}%type_scope Arguments cons {A}%type_scope a l%list_scope : rename
prime = fun p : nat => p <> 1 /\ (forall q : nat, q <d p -> q = 1 \/ q = p) : nat -> Prop Arguments prime _%nat_scope
Forall : forall A : Type, (A -> Prop) -> list A -> Prop
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
Notation lprod := (fold_right Init.Nat.mul 1)
prime_factor : forall n : nat, 2 <= n -> {p : nat | prime p /\ p <d n}
lprod_ge_1 : forall l : list nat, Forall prime l -> 1 <= lprod l
Init.Nat.sub = fix sub (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => n | S k => match m with | 0 => n | S l => sub k l end end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.sub (_ _)%nat_scope
list_max_lt : forall (l : list nat) (n : nat), l <> nil -> list_max l < n < -> Forall (fun k : nat => k < n) l
divides_bool = fun n p : nat => match p mod n with | 0 => true | S _ => false end : nat -> nat -> bool Arguments divides_bool (_ _)%nat_scope
Init.Nat.max = fix max (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => m | S n' => match m with | 0 => n | S m' => S (max n' m') end end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.max (_ _)%nat_scope
Init.Nat.mul = fix mul (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => 0 | S p => m + mul p m end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.mul (_ _)%nat_scope
list_an = fix list_an (a n : nat) {struct n} : list nat := match n with | 0 => nil | S n0 => a :: list_an (S a) n0 end : nat -> nat -> list nat Arguments list_an (_ _)%nat_scope
BinIntDef.Z.of_nat = fun n : nat => match n with | 0 => BinNums.Z0 | S n0 => BinNums.Zpos (BinPos.Pos.of_succ_nat n0) end : nat -> BinNums.Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.of_nat _%nat_scope
Init.Nat.add = fix add (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => m | S p => S (add p m) end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.add (_ _)%nat_scope
prime_rect : forall P : nat -> Type, P 0 -> P 1 -> (forall p : nat, prime p -> P p) -> (forall x y : nat, P x -> P y -> P (x * y)) -> forall n : nat, P n
nat_ind : forall P : nat -> Prop, P 0 -> (forall n : nat, P n -> P (S n)) -> forall n : nat, P n
map_app_inv : forall (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y) (ll : list X) (m n : list Y), map f ll = m ++ n -> {l : list X & {r : list X | ll = l ++ r /\ m = map f l /\ n = map f r}}
no_common_prime_is_coprime : forall x y : nat, x <> 0 -> (forall p : nat, prime p -> p <d x -> p <d y -> False) -> is_gcd x y 1
sum_fold_map : forall (n : nat) (f : nat -> nat), msum Init.Nat.add 0 n f = fold_right Init.Nat.add 0 (map f (list_an 0 n))
Init.Nat.leb = fix leb (n m : nat) {struct n} : bool := match n with | 0 => true | S n' => match m with | 0 => false | S m' => leb n' m' end end : nat -> nat -> bool Arguments Init.Nat.leb (_ _)%nat_scope
list_sum = fun l : list nat => fold_right Init.Nat.add 0 l : list nat -> nat Arguments list_sum _%list_scope
list_max = fun l : list nat => fold_right Init.Nat.max 0 l : list nat -> nat Arguments list_max _%list_scope
Forall_forall_map : forall (X : Type) (f : nat -> X) (n : nat) (l : list X) (P : X -> Prop), l = map f (list_an 0 n) -> (forall i : nat, i < n -> P (f i)) < -> Forall P l
lt = fun n m : nat => S n <= m : nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments lt (_ _)%nat_scope
Init.Nat.eqb = fix eqb (n m : nat) {struct n} : bool := match n with | 0 => match m with | 0 => true | S _ => false end | S n' => match m with | 0 => false | S m' => eqb n' m' end end : nat -> nat -> bool Arguments Init.Nat.eqb (_ _)%nat_scope
divides = fun n k : nat => exists p : nat, k = p * n : nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments divides (_ _)%nat_scope
lprod_app : forall l m : list nat, lprod (l ++ m) = lprod l * lprod m
bounded_search : forall (m : nat) (P : nat -> Type), (forall n : nat, n < m -> P n + (P n -> False)) -> {n : nat & ((n < m) * P n)%type} + {forall n : nat, n < m -> P n -> False}
lmax = fold_right Nat.max 0 : list nat -> nat Arguments lmax _%list_scope
lsum = fold_right Init.Nat.add 0 : list nat -> nat Arguments lsum _%list_scope
prime_algo : forall p : nat, prime p < -> p = 2 \/ 3 <= p /\ ~ 2 <d p /\ (forall n : nat, 3 + 2 * n < p -> ~ 3 + 2 * n <d p)
prime_bool_rec = fix prime_bool_rec (n p : nat) {struct n} : bool := match n with | S (S (S _ as n')) => negb (divides_bool n p) && prime_bool_rec n' p | _ => true end : nat -> nat -> bool Arguments prime_bool_rec (_ _)%nat_scope
is_gcd = fun p q r : nat => r <d p /\ r <d q /\ (forall k : nat, k <d p -> k <d q -> k <d r) : nat -> nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments is_gcd (_ _ _)%nat_scope
ZMicromega.bdepth = fix bdepth (pf : ZMicromega.ZArithProof) : nat := match pf with | ZMicromega.DoneProof => 0 | ZMicromega.EnumProof _ _ l => S (fold_right (fun (pf0 : ZMicromega.ZArithProof) (x : nat) => Nat.max (bdepth pf0) x) 0 l) | ZMicromega.RatProof _ p | ZMicromega.CutProof _ p | ZMicromega.ExProof _ p => S (bdepth p) end : ZMicromega.ZArithProof -> nat
